intro: Clibadium latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and healing properties.
